content:
Posted: May 9, 2015
												A good game.  Very fun.  And no, it's not really a "grind fest" unless you have to have absolutely the best gear in the game right this second.  If you're content with gear that's "good enough" or are willing to wait and work for your stuff then there's really no problem.  Almost everything can be earned just by playing the game.  There are a very few things you can only get by subscribing (or buying a lifetime sub) but those things aren't that good anyway.  The rest of the cash shop stuff can be earned just by playing.For anyone that likes PvP, this game isn't for you.  PvP has never been very good and was never meant to be.  The developer doesn't care about it and only really added it so PvPers would stop whining about wanting it.  That didn't work out very well.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2016
												First off this game will never win any graphics awards as it has a simplistic system because they have a "in game workshop" where you can make your own missions and scenarios in an in built creator.The game itself is very enjoyable as it seriously takes time to have fan service to all movies and series' that make up the cannon universe.The story takes place 32 years after the end of Voyager ad 20 years after the events in the JJ Abrams Star Trek reboot where Spock and Nero get pulled into an alternate timeline after the Romulus system gets destroyed.They link everything together in a compelling storyline that fills in plot holes from the franchise along the way.They have returning actors reprising theircharacters in voice overs for certain "seasons" or sections of the game.The Away team (ground) combat is a little basic compared to other  MMO's but the space combat...oooh the space combat...is some of the most fun I have had in a Sci-Fi game in ages.Seriously on week of playing the game and I bought the Lifetime subscription.There is a in game shop and "crate" system in the game that keeps this free to play game running, but you can quite easily play this game with the free ships you get during seasonal events.It is not a fee to play game as the bought stuff is generally cosmetic or has things just makes things easier. It doesn't break the game.

content:
Posted: January 1
												Star Trek Online is a game you will either absolutely love or hate with a burning passion, no stops in between. Reasons to love it: lots of contents, a strong player base, a friendly community, is a free to play game, and the fact is part of the Star Trek franchise.Reasons to hate it: PvP is almost dead, the items and ships which will require you to open your wallet and throw some money into it, the never ending grinding an the fact is part of the Star Trek franchise.This last point is a great plus to those player familiar with the ST lore, with lots of references to all the TV series and movies, but outsiders might feel lost at times.Regarding the payable content, you can still get the stuff if you're willing to spend time grinding, but it will take a long time. For example, to get a T6 ship you'll need to refine the daily Dilithium quota for 3-4 month depending on the Zen price on the exchange.Overall, the game has a lot to offer, and it's a great and fun option considering you don't need to pay a subscription.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												As an MMORPG this is a fairly solid title until you hit max level.  Unfortunately the end game space content is a little lackluster.  Some of it isn't bad but it gets repetitive.  The storyline content (Episodes) up to max level (and a little bit after depending how fast you hit max level) are amazingly good.  The game is top notch there it actually does feel very much like Star Trek in the episodes.  The public area encounters leave a lot to be desired though as they feel chaotic and not very much like 'Star Trek' as people race around bumping into each other trying to kill ### badguys of X or Y type or what have you.  Overall, however, this game is absolutely worth playing if only to run through the episodes and get that Star Trek feel.  After that, your mileage will vary.  Grab the game... play through the episodes... if you enjoy it stick around for the end game content.  I did for a while.  It'll keep you busy for at least a couple months... it held my attention for nearly a year.

content:

												First of it's a star trek MMO, and while most people will go nah, i'm not touching it, there are a lot of people that will enjoy itso lets start with the pro's and consPro's Continually updates with more Events and content.Learning curve isn't that steep.It's Free to play.Con'sIt's very senstive to certain anti virus / antispyware combos, and will crash at the drop of a hat.early game is free to play, late game at Vice Admiral / whatever your race equiv is (lvl 50) is not competetive for F2P'ers and you will at some point have to spend some money to buy an end game ship.PVP is merciless and you will get trolled.but despite those points, it's a very soild game and you don't really need to be a Trekker to enjoy it (Although it helps), I have so far clocked in around 2 Ish years and i'm still playing it, unlike WoW which kept sucking my bank account dry with it's PPM schemeIs it the best MMO out there, nopeis it fun, I'd say yes, but i'm sure there are other out there that will disagree with meIf you fancy saving / or destroying the galaxy in a fully customisable starship then this is probably the game for youGraphics 7Audio 8 (has some really recognaisable tunes for the trek series)Gameplay 7 (space combat is better than ground, otherwise this would be higher)Longeviety 9 (takes age to lvl to 50 if your a casual gamer)Overall 8.5

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 21, 2015
												I started playint STO shortly after it became F2P. At first it was a great game with a lot of things to discover, but that changed after a couple of weeks/months of play. Every mission is like: travel to this planet or system, defeat the enemies in the orbit of the planet/station or friendly ship, beam down to the planet/station/ship and defeat ~50 enemies in ground combat. Then beam back on board and defeat the reinforcement. Warp to sector space and report to starfleet.Although the story (traveling back in time, meet Kirk, Scotty and various other well known characters) was quiet good, the linear gameplay of just traveling, fighting enemies in space and then on ground was horrible. If I wasn't such a Star Trek Fan, I would have quit playing after 1-2 weeks. The overall gameplay is (from my point of view) horrible and I hate the ground combat. In all series/movies, there are just a few combats with a hand full of enemies. In the game, nearly every mission has a ground combat with about 50 enemies, which is horrible and does not fit into the Star Trek universe.  In space PVE you just need a DPS-ship, so tanking enemies with a cruiser is useless, because enemies will focus on the ship with the highest DPS. Flying a science-ship is also most useless, because they do 2 types of damage (weapon damage and exotic damage). So you can't skill effectefly a high-DPS science-ship.Space PVP does NOT work either. In most cases an enemy ship decloaks behind you, fires all BUFFs and hit you with ~70k DPS, so you are not able to do something against this. So PVP is mainly broken since YEARS.So all about fighting is to get the most DPS out of your ship. Group play is about doing high DPS in a short amount of time. So there is no tactic like - tanking the boss with a cruiser, slowing/knocking him back and apply dots with a science ship. All is about maximising DPS.There is grinding all around. The 5th year anniversary "present" was a mission, where you have to grind for about 3-4 weeks to get a highest tier cruiser. I tried the grinding mission for 4 days. At the second day the mission was broken, so I couldn't end it successfully. At the 3rd day this bug wasn't fixed. On the 4th day I quit and cursed PWE and Cryptic and all the other so called "Developers".Now content is all about getting a Tier 6 ship with REAL MONEY! So NO F2P anymore. You have to grind months of getting a new ship and then just more months for getting adequate equipment.Just a little bit about the story. There is a redone of all episodes from time to time. They just want that you want to replay Star Trek again with new characters, so they can sell you ships/items. The content of the story is sometimes good, but sometimes the conversations and explecitly the jokes are horrible. After you have done all missions, there is almost nothing to do. Star Trek Online is NOT about exploring the universe, other cultures or getting in first contact with other species. It's a poorly space/ground shooter, but the only MMO in Star Trek Theme (until now).

Posted: October 5, 2016
												STO is great. It may have it's flaws, but it makes up for that being Free to Play. They do have event ships, so you don't actually have to spend money on getting a T6. they have a exchange "player controlled". The Exchange enables you to get game shop currency, that way you dont have to spend money, just time for the grind. They have a player shop, you can buy and sell items such as outfits, Lock Box ships, gear and keys for said Lock Boxs. There is a lot of grinding in this game, but it's great, it's sure worth the try. The story is a bit rough at first and in patches later on down the road, but it is overall enjoyable.Played it a lot without using Steam.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2016
												As i am a fan of the star trek franchise i really do enjoy this game, it has a massive ammount of detail to lore and a huge list of ships to command including ships from the federation, romulans and kilngons. this game has a uniqe crafting and upgrading system and offers a large ammount of armaments for you to use. there is only one down side to this game. it takes a lot of time and effort to rank up and make your ships formidable. to have the best experience with this title i would recommend doing the game alongside a friend or join another players fleet so you can ask any questions on how to progress certain things. all in all i would give this game a solid 8/10. as this is a free game there are a lot of things you can actually purchase with real money. such as unique vessels like the intrepid class (voyager) or the defiant class (deep space nine) along side many others. no this is not a pay to win, but buying a few items here and there never hurt.

												Well... i thought this game is going to be dead about half a year ago.... but it's still there and fun from time to time.A big contra: their design choices are VERY bad - unproportional interiors which make you feel like a dwarf is just one example - a game breaker for me, but if you can ignore this you can still have fun in the game.So if you haven't played this lately or at all I can still reccomend that you try it now, after all its free (there is a cash shop but its not needed you can achieve everything without buying... though it makes things less time consuming ^^).(but beware, support is still not very good if this matters to you......)

Posted: October 31, 2016
												A few bugs here and there and a bit of a pay 2 play game as once you have done all the campaign missions which are a little boring you either have to stick with a low end crappy ship or buy ZEN to get a new ship. Graphics are Okay and with the new lighting effect the game is buggy and laggy yet I'm sure Cryptic will fix this. Anyway after a while the game kind of gets boring a lot even when you've repeated the same missions and fleet actions and PVE battles over and over again for the same rewards. This game deserves a 8/10
